name: Charybdis - tree bark journal in black and wheat
description:
Handbound hardback book
Sized 15 x 11 x 2 cm (A6)

Covered with black linen-cotton bookcloth and Mexican amate bark paper. Headbands sewn with coffee stained, off-white linen thread. Approx. 130 pages of gray-brown text weight recycled paper inside, works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media.

Amate paper is made from fig tree bark, thus the name -

The mythical Charybdis Fig Tree was situated above the whirlpool of Charybdis in the Strait of Messina, which connects Tyrrhenian Sea with the Ionian Sea in the central Mediterranean. Little is known of the tree itself, but much more about its sea monster called Charybdis, which was later recognised as a whirlpool caused by meeting currents.

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Bystander - miniature book necklace
description:
Leatherbound book necklace
Sized 3,5 x 3 cm, ~70cm adjustable cord

Covered with dyed, chestnut brown goatskin. Sewn with linen bookbinder's thread. Features approx. 45 pages of antique paper from "Major Lawrence F.L.S." by Emily Lawless, 1888. No valuable bindings were harmed in making of this little creature!

The book comes with black 1mm leather-like cord. 

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Note to self - pamphlet notebook
description:
Handbound notebook with an illustrated cover
Sized 14 x 10 cm

Do you ever feel like him? I made this series of notebooks to celebrate the occasional feelings of indecisiveness, and the mundane acceptance of watching ones life from afar - sometimes everything feels a bit like an interesting film that just happens without you having a say. How nice! You'd say it's a bad thing, but sometimes it has a calming effect. Sometimes it's very relieving just to observe.

A clean, simple design with some modest everyday luxury. All of these booklets feature sturdy covers of recycled or coloured cardstock and they are handsewn in pamphlet stitch, with natural white linen thread. The innards hold a delightful surprise - the paper is off-white archival Munken Pure which is perfectly suitable for all types of pens, pencils, even some ink and watercolour. Each booklet has 32 pages for your (guilty) writing and sketching pleasure. Cover illustration by yours truly.

This listing is for one book.

name: Ad Mortem - cabinet portrait book
description:
Coptic binding
Sized 10 x 6.5 x 2.5 cm

Covers made of black board and an antique cabinet portrait depicting a long-gone lady in dark clothing. Sewn with black bookbinder's thread. Can be closed with two thin, hand braided cords. Approx. 112 pages of gray-brown text weight recycled paper inside, works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media. 

Easy to carry around, fits most bags and pockets!


Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Charybdis - tree bark journal in white
description:
Handbound hardback book 
Sized 15 x 11 x 2 cm (A6)

Covered with natural white linen-cotton bookcloth and Mexican amate bark paper. Headbands sewn with coffee stained, off-white linen thread. Approx. 130 pages of gray-brown text weight recycled paper inside, works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media.

Amate paper is made from fig tree bark, thus the name -

The mythical Charybdis Fig Tree was situated above the whirlpool of Charybdis in the Strait of Messina, which connects Tyrrhenian Sea with the Ionian Sea in the central Mediterranean. Little is known of the tree itself, but much more about its sea monster called Charybdis, which was later recognised as a whirlpool caused by meeting currents.

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Pocket traveler - small leather journal in rust
description:
Leatherbound pocket-sized journal
Sized 10 x 7.5 x 2.5 cm

Flexible leather binding sewn in a variation of longstitch style with brown waxed linen thread. Covered in rusty brown leather with embossed reptile pattern. The wraparound flap can be closed with waxed thread on a leather button sewn in the front cover. I have backed the leather covering material with brown sundyed paper with fern and leaf imagery, which only shows when you open the book.

Approx. 128 pages of smooth, gray-brown recycled paper inside. Works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media! This book is compact and easy to carry around, fits most pockets and purses, and would make a great little traveler's journal. Because of its ingenious structure, it is possible to add small paper ephemera such as magazine clippings, business cards and map pieces without making the book look overstuffed.

Most of the material in this book is recycled or upcycled. I have left the closure threads loose so that you can decide whether you like them that way or wish to braid them, perhaps adding beads and trinkets of your liking.


Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Hreindýr - white vellum and cardstock book
description:
Handbound book
Sized 10.5 x 7 x 2.5 cm 

Covered in textured, white heavyweight cardstock. Sewn through the spine with natural linen bookbinder's thread. Front cover features stitch decorations sewn through a scrap of handdyed Finnish reindeer vellum. The back cover wraps round the foredge and can be closed on a glazed ceramic button with the braided cord. 

Approx. 144 pages of recycled paper inside, with foreleaves made of golden wheat coloured parchment paper. Recycled paper works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media.

I made a small edition of these white books in the summer of 2013. Each book is unique although they do share the same form, which is a historical longstitch binding with parchment details. These delicate one of a kind bindings make especially good gifts or collectables for book aficionados.


Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Punkt - white vellum and cardstock book
description:
Handbound book 
Sized 10.5 x 7 x 2.5 cm

Covered in textured, white heavyweight cardstock. Sewn through the spine with natural linen bookbinder's thread. Front cover features cross-stitch decorations sewn through round pieces cut of handdyed Finnish reindeer vellum. The book can be closed with two thin braided cords.

Approx. 144 pages of cream coloured paper inside, with foreleaves made of ivory coloured parchment paper. The text weight paper in this book works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media, and even some watercolour too.

I made a small edition of these white books in the summer of 2013. Each book is unique although they do share the same form, which is a historical longstitch binding with parchment details. These delicate one of a kind bindings make especially good gifts or collectables for book aficionados.

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Artist book: Omnia mutantur, nihil interit
description: Miniature accordion binding Sized 5.5 x 4.5 x 1.2 cm closed One of a kind, signed Made in 2013 Boards covered with chocolate brown Harmatan goatskin, closure mechanism devised of blue-black raku button around which waxed linen thread can be wrapped. Original landscape illustration made with acrylics, ink and Derwent coloured pencil on archival pastel cardstock. The other side of the accordion is painted black with Indian ink. The familiar Latin phrase Omnia mutantur, nihil interit in this context lends itself to an obscure study of my homeland; both my mental and my physical home, the core place where I come from or where I am perhaps heading to. This book was shown 2013 in Kätköistä Löytyneet miniature book exhibition in Helsinki, Finland.

name: Pocket traveler - small journal in brown calf
description:
Leatherbound pocket-sized journal
Sized 10 x 7.5 x 2.5 cm

Flexible leather binding sewn in a variation of longstitch style with brown waxed linen thread. Covered in handdyed chocolate brown calf leather. The wraparound flap can be closed with waxed thread on a leather button sewn in the front cover. I have backed the leather covering material with brown sundyed paper with fern and leaf imagery, which only shows when you open the book.

Approx. 128 pages of smooth, gray-brown recycled paper inside. Works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media! This book is compact and easy to carry around, fits most pockets and purses, and would make a great little traveler's journal. Because of its ingenious structure, it is possible to add small paper ephemera such as magazine clippings, business cards and map pieces without making the book look overstuffed.

I have left the closure threads loose so that you can decide whether you like them that way or wish to braid them and personalise the book by adding beads and trinkets of your own.

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.

name: Birch - flax journal with woven spine
description:
Handbound sketchbook/journal
Sized 15 x 11 x 2 cm (A6)

Covered with thick and sturdy flax paper in pale, natural shades of sepia. Sewn through the spine with linen thread. The stitches are finished with needle-woven details. The cover of the book wraps round the foredge and can be closed around the leaf motif button with a hand-braided linen cord. Approx. 160 pages of gray-brown recycled paper inside. Works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media.

This book is a variation of the historical longstitch structure with stitches covered in weaving. It somehow reminds me of birch trees, or berkana which is the rune for birch.. While this book is not meant for everyday use it is still very useable and would also make a great gift or a collectable for any book lover.

Little is known of the tree itself, but much more about its sea monster called Charybdis, which was later recognised as a whirlpool caused by meeting currents.

name: 4de Linjen - cabinet portrait book
description:
Coptic binding 
Sized 10 x 6.5 x 2.5 cm

Covers made of pale grey-green board and an antique cabinet portrait depicting a young lady in lovely clothing. Sewn with waxed linen bookbinder's thread. Can be closed with two hand braided cords. Approx. 112 pages of gray-brown text weight recycled paper inside, works beautifully with pens, pencils and all dry media.

Easy to carry around, fits most bags and pockets!

Professional bookbinder quality, made in Finland.
